intro: Zornia diphylla var. conjugata, commonly known as the two-leaved zornia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Leguminosae family, which includes many nitrogen-fixing plants. The species is characterized by its distinctive two-leaf structure, with the lower leaf being significantly larger than the upper one. It produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. This plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or wetland habitats.
